TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE .
He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
A.

DATE the GPE district authority ( ORG ) issued a " sentence order " ( PERSON ) imposing on the applicant , as manager of the F company , fines for CARDINAL administrative offences ( PERSON ) under section CARDINAL ) and ( p ) of LAW ( Arbeitnehmerschutzgesetz ) , in conjunction with further provisions of LAW , as well as other industrial safety regulations ( PERSON ; PERSON ) and LAW ( GPE ) . Having regard to the results of an inspection by ORG ( NORP ) , it found that
( CARDINAL ) no appointment had been made of a person responsible for security matters ( Sicherheitsvertrauensperson ) or a deputy , although the F. company had CARDINAL employees ;
( CARDINAL ) there was not the requisite number of employees who could prove that they had been sufficiently trained in first aid ;
( CARDINAL ) CARDINAL emergency exits were defective and could not be used ;
( CARDINAL ) a gate was defective and did not close safely ; and
( CARDINAL ) CARDINAL cranes had not been regularly checked by ORG .

The authority imposed fines amounting to ( CARDINAL ) ORG CARDINAL with CARDINAL days’ imprisonment in default ; ( CARDINAL ) ORG CARDINAL with CARDINAL ORG imprisonment in default ; ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) ATS CARDINAL with CARDINAL days’ imprisonment in default for each offence ; and ( CARDINAL ) ORG CARDINAL with CARDINAL ORG imprisonment in default . In these and the following proceedings the applicant was assisted by counsel .
On DATE ORG ( Unabhängiger Verwaltungssenat ) , following DATE of hearings , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal .

In its decision , the ORG mentioned that it had consulted the administrative files which sufficiently indicated the relevant facts . However , upon the applicant ’s express request , it had ordered an oral hearing and the taking of evidence from CARDINAL witnesses named by him . Neither the applicant , nor the witnesses ORG , who had been summoned at ORG address , had appeared at DATE court hearing . The applicant ’s counsel had explained the applicant ’s absence with his workload , and the absence of the witness K with his illness although no medical certificates were presented . Counsel had further stated that the witness N could no longer be reached at FAC address without indicating any new address , contrary to his undertaking in court .

As regards the legal assessment , the ORG considered that the objective facts could be established from the ORG report , and were not challenged in the applicant ’s appeal except for the offence of failing to appoint a person responsible for security matters or a deputy . In the latter respect , the ORG , having regard to the material before it , considered that the applicant ’s statements were untrue . As regards the applicant ’s guilt , the ORG , referring to section CARDINAL ) of LAW , found that , in his appeal submissions , the applicant had failed to show that no fault lay with him for the contravention of the provisions of administrative law . If he had shown the necessary care in complying with industrial safety rules and an earlier report of ORG on various shortcomings , the facts constituting the offences would not have occurred .
On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) .

On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE regarding the conviction on the first offence as being unlawful due to a violation of procedural rules . In this respect , ORG found that ORG had failed to hear the witness K , as requested by the applicant , on the question whether or not the applicant had appointed persons responsible for security matters . This witness had been cited to give evidence on a relevant issue . The ORG absence due to health reasons , albeit without medical certificates , had not been sufficient to discharge the ORG of its duty to ensure and , if necessary , enforce the ORG presence and testimony . Referring to section DATE of LAW ( PERSON ) , the court declined to deal with the remainder of the applicant 's complaints . The decision was served on DATE .

In the resumed proceedings , on DATE , ORG again dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and confirmed the administrative fine on the first offence . As to the taking of evidence , the ORG noted that it had scheduled CARDINAL hearings and summoned the witness K , who had not been able to attend the hearings for health reasons and who had subsequently died . Thereupon , a further hearing had been fixed and the witness N had been heard . Having regard to the statements made by N , the ORG found that CARDINAL had been appointed to handle security matters at the company .
B. Relevant domestic law

Pursuant to Article CARDINAL of LAW , administrative courts called " independent administrative tribunals " ( ORG ) were set up in the Länder with effect from DATE . The functions of these tribunals include determining both the factual and the legal issues arising in cases concerning administrative offences . According to ORG and PERSON , their members are lawyers , appointed by ORG for a term of office of DATE . They are independent and must not receive instructions . They can only be dismissed from office upon a decision of ORG itself . GPE on ORG ( PERSON über den ORG PERSON ) repeats to a large extent the provisions of LAW .
By LAW , ORG has jurisdiction to hear , inter alia , applications alleging that an administrative decision is unlawful .
Section CARDINALa of LAW ( PERSON ) , as in force from DATE , reads as follows :

" ORG may decline to deal with a complaint against a decision of an ORG in an administrative criminal case , if no prison sentence or a fine exceeding AS CARDINAL has been imposed and ORG decision would not involve the determination of a legal question of fundamental importance . A legal question of fundamental importance is involved in particular if the challenged decision of ORG is at variance with ORG case - law , if no such case - law exists or if the legal questions at issue have not been answered uniformly in ORG case - law . "
By section ORG ) of that Act ,
" The Administrative Court shall quash the impugned decision if it is unlawful
CARDINAL . by reason of its content , [ or ]
CARDINAL . because the respondent authority lacked jurisdiction , [ or ]
CARDINAL . on account of a breach of procedural rules , in that
( a ) the respondent authority has made findings of fact which are , in an important respect , contradicted by the case file , or
( b ) the facts require further investigation on an important point , or
( c ) procedural rules have been disregarded , compliance with which could have led to a different decision by the respondent authority . "

If ORG quashes the impugned decision , " the administrative authorities [ are ] under a duty ... to take immediate steps , using the legal means available to them , to bring about in the specific case the legal situation which corresponds to ORG view of the law ( PERSON ) " ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) .
